gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. The game combines strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, focusing on the crucial role bees play in our world.

blueTeam.name: The Bombus Navigators
blueTeam.description: Focused on sustainable practices and educational outreach.

redTeam.name: The Apis Aviators
redTeam.description: Specialists in habitat restoration and bee colony recovery.

turns.scenario: Post-Hurricane Recovery: The recent hurricanes have heavily affected bee habitats. The action taken now will determine the survival of the bee populations in these areas.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster

AA.narrative: Both teams focus on habitat restoration. The areas bloom with native flowers, and the bees return. However, it will take some time for the colonies to fully re-establish.

AB.narrative: Red team fosters the habitats while the Blue team ensures the safety of the bees. The balance creates a survival bastion for bees, but the growth of colonies is slower-pace.

BA.narrative: While Blue team re-establishes the habitats, Red team ensures the safety of bees creating a perfect harmony. The bee population faces a strong/quick comeback.

BB.narrative: Both teams focus on creating safe zones for bee colonies. The survival of bees is ensured, but it does threaten the genetic diversity of bees due to relocated colonies.

turns.scenario: Wildfire Restoration: Wildfires have created environmental hazards that could affect the local bee population.

options.A: Seed the fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to support displaced populations

AA.narrative: Both teams concentrate on seeding the ravaged areas. The restored vegetation blossoms, attracting various bee species. While recovery is in line, future wildfires could pose a major threat.

AB.narrative: Restorative actions are taken by the Red team while the Blue team focuses on creating artificial habitats. This division ensures both immediate and long-term stability for bee populations.

BA.narrative: While Blue team seeds the area, the Red team creates the safe habitats. Their combined efforts lead to a speedy recovery and promise a safer future for the bees.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt for creating artificial habitats. Though the relocation helps in the short-term, the lack of natural habitat recovery may affect other local species.

turns.scenario: Sustainable Expansion: With bee populations stabilizing, the teams now face the monumental task of ensuring their continued survival.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness

AA.narrative: Both teams opt for technological solutions and develop state-of-the-art bee sanctuaries. The bee populations thrive but reliance on technology may prove costly in long-term.

AB.narrative: While Red team works on habitat technology, Blue team takes on public awareness. The combined approach fortifies the future of bees and ensures public support for bee conservation.

BA.narrative: The Blue team focuses on technological solutions while Red team heightens public awareness. The result is a large, educated following dedicated to bee conservation and a technological leap in habitat restoration.

BB.narrative: Both teams pool resources to educate the public about bee conservation. The campaign results in an uptick in private conservation efforts, but technologically advanced habitats remain underdeveloped.
